subject: Use port list to find missing floating ips
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-23 12:32:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/e7aa6e6eedfe5a478b927e5db6200b95b227cc38', 'message': "Use port list to find missing floating ips

It's possible for a cloud to have multiple private networks with overlapping
IP ranges. In that case, the check for missing floating ips can
erroneously match a floating ip for a different server.

Ports are actually unique, and are the foreign key between these things.
Instead of starting with list_floating_ips, start with listing the ports
for the server. In the case where OpenStack isn't broken, this will be
the same number of API calls. In the case where it is, there will be one
extra call per server, but ultimately the output will be more correct -
and the fix for the extra load on the cloud is to fix the nova/neutron
port mapping.

Story: 2000845
Change-Id: Ie53a2a144ca2ed812d5441868917996f67b6f454
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-23 12:38:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/7fb3b23d8d1ed5e045d5d3fe66912af34754af95', 'message': "Use port list to find missing floating ips

It's possible for a cloud to have multiple private networks with overlapping
IP ranges. In that case, the check for missing floating ips can
erroneously match a floating ip for a different server.

Ports are actually unique, and are the foreign key between these things.
Instead of starting with list_floating_ips, start with listing the ports
for the server. In the case where OpenStack isn't broken, this will be
the same number of API calls. In the case where it is, there will be one
extra call per server, but ultimately the output will be more correct -
and the fix for the extra load on the cloud is to fix the nova/neutron
port mapping.

Also, fixed the spelling of supplemental.

Story: 2000845
Change-Id: Ie53a2a144ca2ed812d5441868917996f67b6f454

commit_message:
Use port list to find missing floating ips

It's possible for a cloud to have multiple private networks with overlapping
IP ranges. In that case, the check for missing floating ips can
erroneously match a floating ip for a different server.

Ports are actually unique, and are the foreign key between these things.
Instead of starting with list_floating_ips, start with listing the ports
for the server. In the case where OpenStack isn't broken, this will be
the same number of API calls. In the case where it is, there will be one
extra call per server, but ultimately the output will be more correct -
and the fix for the extra load on the cloud is to fix the nova/neutron
port mapping.

Also, fixed the spelling of supplemental.

Story: 2000845
Change-Id: Ie53a2a144ca2ed812d5441868917996f67b6f454
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/87/424087/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _make_address_dict(fip, port): address['OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr'] = port['mac_address'] for port in cloud.search_ports( filters=dict(device_id=server['id'])): for fip in cloud.search_floating_ips( filters=dict(port_id=port['id'])): # This SHOULD return one and only one FIP - but doing # it as a search/list lets the logic work regardless if fip['fixed_ip_address'] not in fixed_ip_mapping: raise exc.OpenStackCloudException( "The cloud returned floating ip {fip} attached" " to server {server} but the fixed ip associated" " with the floating ip in the neutron listing" " does not exist in the nova listing. Something" " is exceptionally broken.".format( fip=fip['id'], server=server['id'])) has_address = False # This check should not be needed, because we should # never get here unless the server didn't have nova # supplied floating ips anyway. BUT - let's be sure. for net in server['addresses'][fixed_net]: if (net['OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr'] == port['mac_address']): has_address = True if not has_address: server['addresses'][fixed_net].append( _make_address_dict(fip))
deleted_lines: def _make_address_dict(fip): # MAC address comes from the port, not the FIP. It also doesn't matter # to anyone at the moment, so just make a fake one address['OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr'] = 'de:ad:be:ef:be:ef' for fip in cloud.list_floating_ips(): if fip['fixed_ip_address'] in fixed_ip_mapping: server['addresses'][fixed_net].append( _make_address_dict(fip))

commit_message:
Removed 'Security considerations' sub-section from security-guide

Change-Id: Ia7efc775153bff775a897e5f4a4d86e4177ee68b
Partial-Bug: #1618552
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/35/426135/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Security considerations ----------------------- - Ensure only authenticated users and backup clients have access to the backup server. - Use data encryption options for storage and transmission of backups. - Use a dedicated and hardened backup servers. The logs for the backup server must be monitored daily and accessible by only few individuals. - Test data recovery options regularly. One of the things that can be restored from secured backups is the images. In case of a compromise, the best practice would be to terminate running instances immediately and then relaunch the instances from the images in the secured backup repository.

commit_message:
Refine migration query added with CI change

The query added with CI change [0] was using the python 'and'
instead of sqlalchemy's 'and_()'. This patch changes that.
This patch also further refines the query to look specifically
for visility 'private' instead of '<> public' for accuracy during
setting of visibility to 'shared'.

[0] I94bc7708b291ce37319539e27b3e88c9a17e1a9f

Change-Id: I6851aa0e5ca8cecaff518609c14cd528bca95ade
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/99/426599/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: UPDATE images SET visibility='shared' WHERE visibility='private' AND id IN (SELECT DISTINCT image_id FROM image_members WHERE deleted != 1);
deleted_lines: UPDATE images SET visibility='shared' WHERE visibility <> 'public' AND id IN (SELECT DISTINCT image_id FROM image_members WHERE deleted != 1);

commit_message:
Max partitions/disks in Operational considerations Arch Design Guide misworded

Revise Scaling Object Storage section of Operational considerations in OpenStack
Architecture Design Guide. Guide uses disks where it should say partitions and
reword incorrect sentence.

Change-Id: Ida78a215ad44da65dc254f5f7f39554f1b8b9dbd
Closes-bug: #1513469
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/37/427337/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: a partition cannot span more than one disk, although a disk can have multiple partitions.system can never have more than 8 partitions, limiting its scalability.of 10 can have up to 1024 (2^10) partitions.
deleted_lines: a partition cannot span more than one disk, so the maximum number of partitions can only be as high as the number of disks.system can never have more than 8 disks, limiting its scalability.of 10 can have up to 1024 (2^10) disks.

commit_message:
Networking architecture of Security guide implies direct DB conn.

Revise Networking architecture of Security guide to describe
there is no direct database access from the agents.

Change-Id: I45bd29c88ffc9eabfaab5f7dc9bce17d64c5ca18
Closes-bug: #1544641
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/01/424801/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: port. The neutron-server requires persistent information be stored in a database using plugins which access the database through AMQP (Advanced Message Queuing Protocol).
deleted_lines: port. The neutron-server and plugin agents require access to a database for persistent storage and access to a message queue for inter-communication.

subject: Neutron auth config value checks corrected
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-30 21:33:47.000000000', 'files': ['security-guide/source/networking/checklist.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/security-doc/commit/c1a0f5e9bf6867ae27230b525cd8a8b78dfbfb0a', 'message': 'Neutron auth config value checks corrected

Previous values mentioned `auth_protocol` and
`identity_uri`, neither of which are valid config
options for keystone middleware as of Newton and possibly
earlier releases.

Change-Id: I62b304a412b22191bf5e0cb606fcac8139e19706
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron auth config value checks corrected

Previous values mentioned `auth_protocol` and
`identity_uri`, neither of which are valid config
options for keystone middleware as of Newton and possibly
earlier releases.

Change-Id: I62b304a412b22191bf5e0cb606fcac8139e19706
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/35/426935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **Pass:** If value of parameter ``auth_uri`` underIdentity API endpoint starting with ``https://`` and value of parameter ``insecure`` under the same ``[keystone_authtoken]`` section in the same ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`` is set to ``False``. **Fail:** If value of parameter ``auth_uri`` under ``[keystone_authtoken]`` section in ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`` is not set to Identity API endpoint starting with ``https://`` or value of parameter ``insecure`` under the same ``[keystone_authtoken]`` section in the same ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`` is set to ``True``.
deleted_lines: **Pass:** If value of parameter ``auth_protocol`` under``https``, or if value of parameter ``identity_uri`` under ``[keystone_authtoken]`` section in ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`` is set to Identity API endpoint starting with ``https://``. **Fail:** If value of parameter ``auth_protocol`` under ``[keystone_authtoken]`` section in ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`` is set to ``http```, or if value of parameter ``identity_uri`` under ``[keystone_authtoken]`` section in ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`` is not set to Identity API endpoint starting with ``https://``.

commit_message:
Add glance_api_servers check to Block storage TLS Glance check

glance_api_servers should be checked for TLS usage in addition to
checking for certification verification.

Change-Id: I4b5d6f1967cea15546b6aad8478a1dc4b374d1cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/87/426887/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: that all components communicate with each other using a securedsection in ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf`` is set to ``False`` and value of parameter ``glance_api_servers`` is set to a value starting with ``https://``.section in ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf`` is set to ``True`` or the value of parameter ``glance_api_servers`` is set to a value that does not start with ``https://``.
deleted_lines: all the components must communicate with each other using a securedsection in ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf`` is set to ``False``.section in ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf`` is set to ``True``.

cluster and cluster template.

cluster table and details view.

For now, we can update only node count for cluster.

commit_message:
Add update action for cluster template

This patch adds update action as item action into
cluster template table and details view.

To be available updating 'lables', needs to fix bug/1638863

Change-Id: Iee1eec7bc7d232e743d3420a98f7ee3128d3f7f1
Implements: blueprint baymodel-update

commit_message:
fix duplicated sg rules check for IPv6 ICMP

Security group rules with ethertype=IPv6, and no more parameters are
different, but only protocol are in different alias for IPv6-ICMP
(icmp, icmpv6, ipv6-icmp) should be considered as duplicated.

Change-Id: I805c445ab41b50fb40baf0d41f6ca99b1abe6b43
Closes-Bug: #1582500

commit_message:
Update PCI documenation

This patch add documentation for 'PCI change password required upon
first use' and replaces the references to the ignore user IDs config
options with instructions for updating the new user options attributes.

Change-Id: I4f8fed9d0a627bbdbced6bb82f38d6e3e55d0a03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/23/426823/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: locked out by setting the user options attribute ``ignore_lockout_failure_attempts`` to ``True`` via an update API (``POST/PATCH /v3/users``) call.Force users to immediately change their password upon first use --------------------------------------------------------------- PCI-DSS 8.2.6 requires users to change their password for first time use and upon an administrative password reset. Within the identity `user API`_, `create user` and `update user` are considered administrative password changes. Whereas, `change password for user` is a self-service password change. Once this feature is enabled, new users, and users that have had their password reset, will be required to change their password at the next authentication (first use), before being able to access any services. Prior to enabling this feature, you will want to exempt any users, especially service account users, that you do not wish to be required to change their password. You can mark a user as exempt by setting the user options attribute ``ignore_change_password_upon_first_use`` to ``True`` via an update API (``POST/PATCH /v3/users``) call. .. WARNING:: Failure to mark service users as exempt from this requirement will result in your service account passwords becoming expired after being reset. When ready, you can configure it so that users are forced to change their password upon first use by setting ``change_password_after_first_use``: .. code-block:: ini [security_compliance] change_password_after_first_use = True .. _`user API`: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#users setting the user options attribute ``ignore_password_expiry`` to ``True`` via an update API (``POST/PATCH /v3/users``) call.The above example will not allow a user to create a new password that is the same as any of their last 4 previous passwords.
deleted_lines: locked out by adding their user ID to the ``lockout_ignored_user_ids`` list: .. code-block:: ini [security_compliance] lockout_ignored_user_ids = 3a54353c9dcc44f690975ea768512f6a,14b78ed1421a47d0b741ba218e1a49a1adding their user ID to ``password_expires_ignore_user_ids`` list: .. code-block:: ini [security_compliance] password_expires_ignore_user_ids = 3a54353c9dcc44f690975ea768512f6a,ed84c3b95b814ff2827967e531f09247 In this example, the password for user IDs ``3a54353c9dcc44f690975ea768512f6a`` and ``ed84c3b95b814ff2827967e531f09247`` would never expire.The above example will not allow a user to create a new password that is the same as any of their last 4 previous passwords.

commit_message:
Add validation for mfa rule validator (storage)

Add the same validation as used for jsonschema for the
_mfa_rules_validator_list_of_lists_of_strings_no_duplicates function.
This ensures any validation changes to one will stay in lockstep with
the other.

The _mfa_rules_validator_list_of_lists_of_strings_no_duplicates function
received some minor updates for readability and comments added.

Change-Id: Ifd285acf01c15a8fe5525acb5458a85aaa76656f
bp: per-user-auth-plugin-reqs

Cleanup TODO, AuthContext and AuthInfo to auth.core

Moved AuthContext and AuthInfo to keystone.auth.core as they are shared
code bits and not exclusively controller specific.

commit_message:
Process and validate auth methods against MFA rules

Process and validate the auth methods used by a given auth request
against the user's MFA ruleset(s) and ensure the required auth
methods have been used. If insufficient auth methods are used
an "InsufficientAuthMethods" exception is raised (401) indicating
the reason for failure.

Change-Id: I2a83aa164f1c17352807188bfbaae17d909b3e5f
bp: per-user-auth-plugin-reqs
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/48/423548/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log import six from keystone.auth import controllers from keystone.common import dependency from keystone.i18n import _, _LI, _LE LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) @dependency.requires('identity_api') class UserMFARulesValidator(object): """Helper object that can validate the MFA Rules.""" @property def _auth_methods(self): if controllers.AUTH_PLUGINS_LOADED: return set(controllers.AUTH_METHODS.keys()) raise RuntimeError(_('Auth Method Plugins are not loaded.')) def check_auth_methods_against_rules(self, user_id, auth_methods): """Validate the MFA rules against the successful auth methods. :param user_id: The user's ID (uuid). :type user_id: str :param auth_methods: List of methods that were used for auth :type auth_methods: set :returns: Boolean, ``True`` means rules match and auth may proceed, ``False`` means rules do not match. """ user_ref = self.identity_api.get_user(user_id) try: rules = self.parse_rule_structure(user_ref['mfa_rules']) except ValueError: LOG.error(_LE('Corrupt rule data structure for user %(user_id)s, ' 'no rules loaded.'), {'user_id': user_id}) rules = set() if not rules or not user_ref.mfa.enabled: # return quickly if the rules are disabled for the user or not set LOG.debug('User MFA Rules not processed for %(user_id)s. ' 'Rule list: %(rules)r (Enabled: %(enabled)s).', {'user_id': user_id, 'rules': user_ref['mfa_rules'], 'enabled': user_ref['mfa_rules_enabled']}) return True for r in rules: # NOTE(notmorgan): We only check against the actually loaded # auth methods meaning that the keystone administrator may # disable an auth method, and a rule will still pass making it # impossible to accidently lock-out a subset of users with a # bad keystone.conf r_set = r.intersection(self.auth_methods) if auth_methods.issuperset(set(r_set)): # Rule Matches no need to continue, return here. LOG.debug('User %(user_id)s auth methods %(methods)r ' 'matched MFA rule %(rule)r. Loaded ' 'auth_methods: %(loaded)s', {'user_id': user_id, 'rule': r_set, 'loaded': self._auth_methods}) return True LOG.debug('User %(user_id)s auth methods %(methods)r did not match a ' 'MFA rule in %(rules)r.', {'user_id': user_id, 'methods': auth_methods, 'rules': rules}) return False @staticmethod def parse_rule_structure(rules): """Validate and parse the rule data structure. Rule sets must be in the form of list of lists. The lists may not have duplicates and must not be empty. The top-level list may be empty indicating that no rules exist. :param rules: The list of rules from the user_ref :type rules: list :returns: set of sets ensuring no duplicated rules. :raises: ValueError """ rule_set = set() if not isinstance(rules, list): raise ValueError(_('rules list must be a list of lists, got ' '%(type)s') % {'type': type(rules)}) if not rules: # No rules exist. return rule_set for r_list in rules: if not isinstance(r_list, list): LOG.info(_LI('Ignoring Rule %(rule)r; rule must be a list of ' 'strings.'), {'type': type(r_list)}) continue if r_list: # No empty rules are allowed. for item in r_list: if not isinstance(item, six.string_types): # Rules may only contain strings for method names # Reject a rule with non-string values LOG.info(_LI('Ignoring Rule %(rule)r; rule contains ' 'non-string values.'), {'rule': r_list}) else: # NOTE(notmorgan): Use of sets here ensures no # duplicate rules and no duplicate elements in the # rules. rule_set.add(set(r_list)) return rule_set

commit_message:
Fix bad error message from FernetUtils

FernetUtils is giving incorrect error messages to administrators
indicating that [fernet_tokens] option is always where the
fernet repository information is stored even if it is referenced
from the [credential] option group.

Change-Id: I7b8344bb306eeb0a9e1cf5093dfd42d3e6c2dd1b

commit_message:
Refresh Ansible facts after installing packages

this will help when running ironic install against a clean remote node,
as for example, in testing mode virtual interfaces will be created only
after libvirt installation and will not be part of ansible facts until
facts are refreshed.

Change-Id: Ied18741dafe53bd32064548b88d5f05f86b76410

commit_message:
Create volume from private volume type

The testcase validates that creating a volume from a private
volume type fail.

Change-Id: I031e92b4ccee6e701ac40cdac2dad88b1c32262c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/52/426552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.idempotent_id('8c09f849-f225-4d78-ba87-bffd9a5e0c6f') def test_create_volume_with_private_volume_type(self): # Should not be able to create volume with private volume type. params = {'os-volume-type-access:is_public': False} volume_type = self.create_volume_type(**params) self.assertRaises(lib_exc.NotFound, self.create_volume, volume_type=volume_type['id'])

roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Allow overriding the disk caching method

Allow users to override the disk caching method used by the VMs.

commit_message:
Switch to using generic groups with Pure driver

This adds implementations of consistent generic volume
groups to the Pure volume drivers. They pretty much
just re-use the CG implementations, and if the group
being created isn't a CG then we bail out and allow
the generic group handling to take care of it.

Change-Id: I02080a1c2eddf93513793ae13adf88d869770a2e
Implements: blueprint pure-generic-volume-groups

commit_message:
Process json based on content-type

OpenStack provides content-type which we can respond to. That we do not
currently provide it in our unittests is our fault. So let's provide it.

Change-Id: Ib20f4df950cbedf404c0fbe3ef4c39660eb1b70f
Depends-On: Iaef2a140e33fc48f8bfa8ff4769eded37ce152c6

added_lines: # Let's only autoprocess things that are actually json if response.headers.get('Content-Type') != 'application/json': if not response.content: # This doens't have any content return response try: result_json = response.json() except Exception: raise exc.OpenStackCloudHTTPError( "Problems decoding json from response." " Reponse: {code} {reason}." " Headers: {headers}. Content: {content}".format( code=response.status_code, reason=response.reason, headers=response.headers, content=response.content), response=response) request_id = response.headers.get('x-openstack-request-id') if task_manager._is_listlike(result_json): return meta.obj_list_to_dict( result_json, request_id=request_id) # Wrap the keys() call in list() because in python3 keys returns # a "dict_keys" iterator-like object rather than a list json_keys = list(result_json.keys()) if len(json_keys) > 1 and result_key: result = result_json[result_key] elif len(json_keys) == 1: result = result_json[json_keys[0]] else: # Passthrough the whole body - sometimes (hi glance) things # come through without a top-level container. Also, sometimes # you need to deal with pagination result = result_json
deleted_lines: # Glance image downloads just return the data in the body if response.headers.get('Content-Type') in ( 'text/plain', 'application/octet-stream'): else: if not response.content: # This doens't have any content return response try: result_json = response.json() except Exception: raise exc.OpenStackCloudHTTPError( "Problems decoding json from response." " Reponse: {code} {reason}".format( code=response.status_code, reason=response.reason), response=response) request_id = response.headers.get('x-openstack-request-id') if task_manager._is_listlike(result_json): return meta.obj_list_to_dict( result_json, request_id=request_id) # Wrap the keys() call in list() because in python3 keys returns # a "dict_keys" iterator-like object rather than a list json_keys = list(result_json.keys()) if len(json_keys) > 1 and result_key: result = result_json[result_key] elif len(json_keys) == 1: result = result_json[json_keys[0]] else: # Passthrough the whole body - sometimes (hi glance) things # come through without a top-level container. Also, sometimes # you need to deal with pagination result = result_json

commit_message:
Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

reno will eventually check for the -eol tag when a stable
branch isn't found in:

I41ab682f081e7fd39ea534b7e2180c2109ca34ef

Change-Id: Ie54f69f5c1f91a3781c876f035fe9ed838e11c08
(cherry picked from commit 4a237c02e43dbefb61a1b1f34b3e268593b5061a)
(cherry picked from commit 271aefd953941554aa432eb7a2e0c296684962ca)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/410875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :branch: liberty-eol

commit_message:
Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

reno will eventually check for the -eol tag when a stable
branch isn't found in:

I41ab682f081e7fd39ea534b7e2180c2109ca34ef

Change-Id: Ie54f69f5c1f91a3781c876f035fe9ed838e11c08
(cherry picked from commit 4a237c02e43dbefb61a1b1f34b3e268593b5061a)

revisions:

commit_message:
Add dictionary check for the port_details

When we install mac spoofing protection, we didn't add
check for the mac_address in the port_details. This will
have potential issue as the mac_address field is not the
mandatory field in port data model.

This patch set is to add extra check in the port_details
dictionary to avoid any unneccessary exception

Change-Id: Ie3a6cab6a9c51e8ab32ae77b67bbc08eab184319
Closes-Bug: 1597861
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/36/336136/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mac_addresses = set() if port_details.get('mac_address'): mac_addresses |= {port_details['mac_address']}

commit_message:
Add pGSQL support for pdns4 driver in devstack

Change-Id: Iae8c8cd2d599aa3e5756786f5844231ea0e366ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/62/408262/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif is_service_enabled postgresql; then PDNS+=" pdns-backend-pgsql" die $LINENO "PDNS4 backend only supports MySQL / pgSQL" elif is_service_enabled postgresql; then sudo tee -a $POWERDNS_CFG_DIR/pdns.conf > /dev/null <<EOF # Launch gpgsql backend launch=gpgsql # gmysql parameters gpgsql-host=$DATABASE_HOST gpgsql-user=$DATABASE_USER gpgsql-password=$DATABASE_PASSWORD gpgsql-dbname=designate_pdns gpgsql-dnssec=yes EOF die $LINENO "PDNS4 backend only supports MySQL / pgSQL" elif is_service_enabled postgresql; then sudo psql -U root -d designate_pdns -f $DESIGNATE_PLUGINS/backend-pdns4-pgsql-db.sql

commit_message:
Make path to ironic-rootwrap dynamic

When using bifrost on CentOS the hardcoded path to
/usr/local/bin for ironic-rootwrap is incorrect.

This change moves the value of the path to a variable
held within the roles default variables for distribution
families.

Change-Id: Ia2823ae3240583173fd97251641c09c4dee07c6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/56/422856/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
fullstack: HA failover with l2pop test

This change is adding a L3 HA failover test.

We create L3 HA router on two host machines and boot vm on another
host machine. neutron-server will be running in centralized machine.
To test L3 HA failover, we kill neutron server and shutdown master
host machine, and see vm can successfully ping the router interface.

Co-Authored-By: Assaf Muller <amuller@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idde206abe36021287aaceb4ac968694b774d9940
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/87/286087/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import osimport testscenariosfrom neutron.tests.fullstack.resources import machine load_tests = testscenarios.load_tests_apply_scenarios class TestHARouterFailover(base.BaseFullStackTestCase): def setUp(self): # This test is taking 180 to 380 seconds to complete. os.environ["OS_TEST_TIMEOUT"] = str(1800) host_descriptions = [ environment.HostDescription(l3_agent=True), environment.HostDescription(l3_agent=True), environment.HostDescription()] env = environment.Environment( environment.EnvironmentDescription(), host_descriptions) super(TestHARouterFailover, self).setUp(env) def _is_ha_router_active_on_one_agent(self, router_id): agents = self.client.list_l3_agent_hosting_routers(router_id)['agents'] if len(agents) == 2 and ( agents[0]['ha_state'] != agents[1]['ha_state']): return True return False def _create_ha_router(self, tenant_id): router = self.safe_client.create_router(tenant_id, ha=True) utils.wait_until_true( functools.partial( self._is_ha_router_active_on_one_agent, router['id']), timeout=90, sleep=3) return router def _is_ha_router_interface_up(self, router_id): ports = self.client.list_ports( device_owner='network:router_interface')['ports'] if ports[0]['status'] == 'ACTIVE': return True return False def block_until_interface_up(self, router_id): utils.wait_until_true( functools.partial( self._is_ha_router_interface_up, router_id), timeout=90, sleep=3) def _is_server_down(self): return not self.environment.neutron_server.server_is_live() def block_until_server_down(self): utils.wait_until_true( functools.partial( self._is_server_down), timeout=90, sleep=3) def _get_router_interface_address(self): ports = self.client.list_ports( device_owner='network:router_interface')['ports'] for port in ports: return port['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'] def _get_host_for_active_ha_router_replica(self, router_id): result = self.client.list_l3_agent_hosting_routers(router_id) hostname = next( agent['host'] for agent in result['agents'] if agent['ha_state'] == 'active') for host in self.environment.hosts: if host.hostname == hostname: return host def test_ha_router_failover(self): tenant_uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() router = self._create_ha_router(tenant_uuid) network = self.safe_client.create_network(tenant_uuid) subnet = self.safe_client.create_subnet( tenant_uuid, network['id'], '20.0.0.0/24', enable_dhcp=False) # hosts[0] and hosts[1] are hosting ha router. # host[2] is not having l3 agent. vm = self.useFixture( machine.FakeFullstackMachine( self.environment.hosts[2], network['id'], tenant_uuid, self.safe_client)) self.safe_client.add_router_interface(router['id'], subnet['id']) router_ip = self._get_router_interface_address() active_host = self._get_host_for_active_ha_router_replica(router['id']) self.block_until_interface_up(router['id']) vm.block_until_ping(router_ip) self.environment.neutron_server.process_fixture.stop() self.block_until_server_down() active_host.disconnect() vm.block_until_ping(router_ip) # server needed for cleanup self.environment.neutron_server.process_fixture.process.start( block=True) utils.wait_until_true(self.environment.neutron_server.server_is_live)

commit_message:
l3_db: Put next-hop finding code into a separate method

So that plugins with router-interface-fip extension can
override it.  With the extension, an FIP might be associated
via a non-gateway router interface.

Related-Bug: #1633424
Related-Bug: #1566191
Change-Id: I84ea6f891caf11d4f0d1bccd8605fed62830fd40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/34/404034/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(yamamoto): This method is an override point for plugins # inheriting this class. Do not optimize this out. def find_next_hop_for_fip(self, context, floatingip_db): """Find a next-hop address for a route from the floating_network_id network to the floating-ip. :param floatingip_db: The db entry for the floating ip :returns: The next-hop address or None """ # NOTE(tidwellr) use admin context here # tenant may not own the router and that's OK on a FIP association router_id = floatingip_db.router_id router = self._get_router(context.elevated(), router_id) gw_port = router.gw_port next_hop = None for fixed_ip in gw_port.fixed_ips: addr = netaddr.IPAddress(fixed_ip.ip_address) if addr.version == constants.IP_VERSION_4: next_hop = fixed_ip.ip_address break return next_hop next_hop = self.find_next_hop_for_fip(context, floatingip_db)
deleted_lines: # NOTE(tidwellr) use admin context here # tenant may not own the router and that's OK on a FIP association router = self._get_router(context.elevated(), router_id) gw_port = router.gw_port for fixed_ip in gw_port.fixed_ips: addr = netaddr.IPAddress(fixed_ip.ip_address) if addr.version == constants.IP_VERSION_4: next_hop = fixed_ip.ip_address break

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ie24feb58f3c12fe36d8a99fc048f39801c281e53

commit_message:
Allow MAC address update for direct-physical ports

Currently, neutron doesn't allow updating MAC address for direct-physical
ports.  However, after a resize or a migration, a new PCI device is
allocated and attached to the guest.  In this case the MAC address of the
interface in the guest changes will correspond to the new physical
device.  This causes DHCP request on this interface to fail because the
MAC address in the guest and the neutron port are different.

This patches fixes neutron to allow MAC address change for a direct-physical
port.

Co-authored-by: Matt Peters <matt.peters@windriver.com>

Change-Id: I179a0fad8d53a324fdbf23fb8bb90acc472b3cee
Closes-bug: #1617452

commit_message:
Destroy embedded eswitch when device's VFs are not used

In case there is no VF used, we can safely delete the embedded eswitch and free
it from memory.

Change-Id: Id94aaf2b56dbc1c4175b39e8f51bc33b1c4689f9

commit_message:
ML2 drivers should be able to skip binding port on binding:profile update

This patch add methon check_port_rebind to make ml2 drivers could be able
to skip some unnecessary binding .

Change-Id: I0d7b50d898ce8a29b11d66b482e10dc074d30486
Closes-Bug: 1646379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/30/405930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: changes = changes or self.mechanism_manager.check_port_rebind( mech_context)

commit_message:
Update VXLAN UDP port value in neutron DB

The value for Vxlan UDP port should be updated in
'ml2_vxlan_endpoints' table with the values configured
in ml2_conf.ini at L2 agent side.

The tunnel_sync() RPC should send the UDP port to it.

Implementation:
tunnel_sync rpc signature upgrade to obtain 'udp_port'.

Closes-Bug: #1373359
Co-Authored-By: Romil Gupta <romilg@hp.com>

Change-Id: I7d32335943106dbc609dd071f89fbcc0053dc36f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/91/153891/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.agent.host, self.agent.vxlan_udp_port)

subject: Handle empty SR-IOV 'physical_device_mappings' config option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-08 15:40:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/01a9e30fc392f556926c34133667b0d2148cddf6', 'message': "Handle empty SR-IOV 'physical_device_mappings' config option

'physical_device_mappings' config option is deprecated
therefore the SRIOV agent should handle an empty mapping.

Partial-bug: #1616442

Change-Id: Ie2534cdd95daa632990b93684589943cea723c1b
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-08 17:25:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/eb698b5b74b0a23d2d78c96e3f1448e2391ef8d0', 'message': "Handle empty SR-IOV 'physical_device_mappings' config option

'physical_device_mappings' config option should handle
an empty mapping configuration because it is a valid value.

Partial-bug: #1616442

Change-Id: Ie2534cdd95daa632990b93684589943cea723c1b
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-14 07:45:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0aea0cba647dc26a43b8aa7a653417df7c5489b5', 'message': "Handle empty SR-IOV 'physical_device_mappings' config option

'physical_device_mappings' config option should handle
an empty mapping configuration because it is a valid value.

commit_message:
Handle empty SR-IOV 'physical_device_mappings' config option

'physical_device_mappings' config option should handle
an empty mapping configuration because it is a valid value.

Partial-bug: #1616442

Change-Id: Ie2534cdd95daa632990b93684589943cea723c1b

commit_message:
Impose argument size limit on the L2 agent bulk RPC calls

The bulk RPC calls, update_device_list and
get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices, have marginal performance
benefit but don't scale as RPC timeouts are inherently constant and
port density per server will increase in future.  Though the default
limit of 100 is arbitrary, it preserves >=99% of performance benefit
of the bulk RPC calls.

Change-Id: Ief2dfc0e87eb56d230d9d4033a773e1ca0d29c9c
Related-blueprint: restructure-l2-agent
Closes-Bug: 1430999
Closes-Bug: 1528895

commit_message:
[WIP] Make adding allowed pair address in ipset optional

At this moment when we add allowed pair address for one port,
allowed pair ip address is added in ipset - so it becomes
allowed pair for all ip addresses in security group
where port belongs.

This behaviour can be confusing, so current change will introduce
new parameter for allowed pair address ``include_in_security_group``
which will make possible add allowed pair only for one port.

Closes-bug: #1622654
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Benton <kevin@benton.pub>

Change-Id: I7e9a38882c2a8b0de7b4c9608bc2051afecc7ae8

added_lines: r_4, r_6 = self._check_if_allowed_pair_in_ipset_or_make_rule(port) if r_4: ipv4_iptables_rules += r_4 if r_6: ipv6_iptables_rules += r_6 def _check_if_allowed_pair_in_ipset_or_make_rule(self, port): mac_ipv4_pairs = [] mac_ipv6_pairs = [] ipv4_rules = [] ipv6_rules = [] if isinstance(port.get('allowed_address_pairs'), list): for address_pair in port['allowed_address_pairs']: self._build_ipv4v6_mac_ip_list(address_pair['mac_address'], address_pair['ip_address'], mac_ipv4_pairs, mac_ipv6_pairs) for sg in port['security_groups']: for mac, ip in mac_ipv4_pairs: if (sg not in self.sg_members or ip not in self.sg_members[sg][constants.IPv4]): ipv4_rules += [comment_rule( '-s %s -m mac --mac-source %s -j RETURN' % (ip, mac.upper()), comment=ic.PAIR_ALLOW)] for mac, ip in mac_ipv6_pairs: if (sg not in self.sg_members or ip not in self.sg_members[sg][constants.IPv6]): ipv6_rules += [comment_rule( '-s %s -m mac --mac-source %s -j RETURN' % (ip, mac.upper()), comment=ic.PAIR_ALLOW)] return ipv4_rules, ipv6_rules

subject: objects: for Pager, handle comparison with None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-19 13:10:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f0b9b5d139275624395c8e1ca49065fa8ec9279f', 'message': "objects: for Pager, handle comparison with None

Sometimes it becomes handy to be able to compare a pager with None,
since it's the default value for _pager argument in get_objects().
Specifically, such a need may arise in unit tests that need to match

commit_message:
objects: for Pager, handle comparison with None

Sometimes it becomes handy to be able to compare a pager with None,
since it's the default value for _pager argument in get_objects().
Specifically, such a need may arise in unit tests that need to match
arguments passed into get_objects against expected pagers.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I2274a6c8fc07bb7255e817828653e018968ff932
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/55/357855/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_comparison_None(self): pager = base.Pager() self.assertFalse(pager.__eq__(None))

commit_message:
objects: avoid additional fetch for prefixes on pool get

This is bad for scalability, since for every listed pool, we fetch a
list of its prefixes, instead of pulling the data from data model
relationship.

Switched prexises field to ListOfObjectsField and utilize automatic
population of synthetic fields from relationships as implemented by
Ie54d9f51642edec1f4533062eb8306b78a1b6f20.

Change-Id: Id23b44cc11d4ddba2706c30ef4d4f2b3cf603fae
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Clear bindings after subports are removed from a trunk

This step was omitted during the subport removal phase
to avoid potential races when two agents are operating
on a trunk in a short time window (e.g. because a VM is
migrating).

This patch resolves tha race when a VM is live migrating
by introducing a new method that agents can safely call
when removing subports: the bindings are cleared only if
the trunk's associated host is the agent requesting the
clear operation, and ignored otherwise. The race caused
by VM delete/boot in short sequence is still a possibility
though this patch reduces its likelihood somewhat.

The patch also shuffles a few things around on the
RPC Server-side to enable reuse of smaller functions.

Closes-bug: #1639111

Change-Id: I4a041c2964b1beb2dad5536daf80c45505202dc9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/30/410930/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Faster _get_devices_details_list_and_failed_devices

By querying all devices at once, the RPC is 10~15% faster.

Change-Id: Ic27b9411809fbbe42dbd56cb7dc0c053b9367fa2
Related-bug: 1430999
Related-Blueprint: restructure-l2-agent

added_lines: from sqlalchemy import or_ def get_bound_ports_context(self, plugin_context, port_ids, host=None, cached_networks=None): if not len(port_ids): return [] session = plugin_context.session with session.begin(subtransactions=True): filter_stmt = [] for port_id in port_ids: filter_stmt.append(models_v2.Port.id.startswith(port_id)) ports_db = (session.query(models_v2.Port). filter(or_(*filter_stmt)).all()) keylens = set(map(len, port_ids)) if len(keylens) > 1: LOG.warning(_LW("Varying keylen for port_ids. " "Results may be incorrect")) keylen = min(keylens) # TODO(iwamoto): check for MultipleResultsFound port_db_dict = dict([(p.id[:keylen], p) for p in ports_db]) port_ctxt_list = [] for port_id in port_ids: if port_id[:keylen] not in port_db_dict: LOG.debug("No ports have port_id starting with %s", port_id) port_ctxt_list.append(None) continue port_db = port_db_dict[port_id[:keylen]] port = self._make_port_dict(port_db) network = (cached_networks or {}).get(port['network_id']) if not network: network = self.get_network(plugin_context, port['network_id']) cached_networks[port['network_id']] = network if port['device_owner'] == const.DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE: binding = db.get_dvr_port_binding_by_host( session, port['id'], host) if not binding: LOG.error( _LE("Binding info for DVR port %s not found"), port_id) port_ctxt_list.append(None) continue levels = db.get_binding_levels(session, port_db.id, host) port_context = driver_context.PortContext( self, plugin_context, port, network, binding, levels) else: binding = port_db.port_binding if not binding: LOG.info(_LI("Binding info for port %s was not found, " "it might have been deleted already."), port_id) port_ctxt_list.append(None) continue levels = db.get_binding_levels(session, port_db.id, port_db.port_binding.host) port_context = driver_context.PortContext( self, plugin_context, port, network, binding, levels) port_ctxt_list.append(port_context) return [(self._bind_port_if_needed(pc) if pc else None) for pc in port_ctxt_list]

commit_message:
DNM: neutron_lib.callback test

DO NOT MERGE

This patch is used to test the effects of neutron_lib's callback
refactor/enhancement [1]. To that end it'll progressively update
neutron to use neutron_lib.callbacks.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/346554/

Change-Id: I5293d661dd19e13fe09eca25412baef9ce42dac1

commit_message:
Fix devstack iptables_v2 driver configuration

This patch fix the driver configuration when config fwaas_v2
enable. Set "FWAAS_DRIVER" to iptables_v2.

Change-Id: Ia6e7d4ce922e569d460a0de755f0760d2a171345

the Neutron tree, Neutron-specific code only should be in

commit_message:
Move Transaction class to its own file

The Transaction class is used outside of Neutron. To make it more
clear that, to avoid breaking external projects, neutron-specific
changes belong in the NeutronOVSDBTransaction class, the
Transaction class is moved under the native/ directory.

Change-Id: I3d1630484d156f9fbbb21f32639812d37767fce3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/389347/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import time from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import excutils from ovs.db import idl from six.moves import queue as Queue from neutron._i18n import _ from neutron.agent.ovsdb import api from neutron.agent.ovsdb.native import idlutils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class Transaction(api.Transaction): def __init__(self, api, ovsdb_connection, timeout, check_error=False, log_errors=True): self.api = api self.check_error = check_error self.log_errors = log_errors self.commands = [] self.results = Queue.Queue(1) self.ovsdb_connection = ovsdb_connection self.timeout = timeout self.expected_ifaces = set() def __str__(self): return ", ".join(str(cmd) for cmd in self.commands) def add(self, command): """Add a command to the transaction returns The command passed as a convenience """ self.commands.append(command) return command def commit(self): self.ovsdb_connection.queue_txn(self) try: result = self.results.get(timeout=self.timeout) except Queue.Empty: raise api.TimeoutException( _("Commands %(commands)s exceeded timeout %(timeout)d " "seconds") % {'commands': self.commands, 'timeout': self.timeout}) if isinstance(result, idlutils.ExceptionResult): if self.log_errors: LOG.error(result.tb) if self.check_error: raise result.ex return result def pre_commit(self, txn): pass def post_commit(self, txn): for command in self.commands: command.post_commit(txn) def do_commit(self): self.start_time = time.time() attempts = 0 while True: if attempts > 0 and self.timeout_exceeded(): raise RuntimeError(_("OVS transaction timed out")) attempts += 1 # TODO(twilson) Make sure we don't loop longer than vsctl_timeout txn = idl.Transaction(self.api.idl) self.pre_commit(txn) for i, command in enumerate(self.commands): LOG.debug("Running txn command(idx=%(idx)s): %(cmd)s", {'idx': i, 'cmd': command}) try: command.run_idl(txn) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() as ctx: txn.abort() if not self.check_error: ctx.reraise = False seqno = self.api.idl.change_seqno status = txn.commit_block() if status == txn.TRY_AGAIN: LOG.debug("OVSDB transaction returned TRY_AGAIN, retrying") idlutils.wait_for_change(self.api.idl, self.time_remaining(), seqno) continue elif status == txn.ERROR: msg = _("OVSDB Error: %s") % txn.get_error() if self.log_errors: LOG.error(msg) if self.check_error: # For now, raise similar error to vsctl/utils.execute() raise RuntimeError(msg) return elif status == txn.ABORTED: LOG.debug("Transaction aborted") return elif status == txn.UNCHANGED: LOG.debug("Transaction caused no change") elif status == txn.SUCCESS: self.post_commit(txn) return [cmd.result for cmd in self.commands] def elapsed_time(self): return time.time() - self.start_time def time_remaining(self): return self.timeout - self.elapsed_time() def timeout_exceeded(self): return self.elapsed_time() > self.timeout

commit_message:
Add permissions to remove proxy metadata process

The external_process.ProcessManager was been used to
manage metadata proxy prcesses in l3 agent and dhcp agent.
When the manage process runs cleanup method,
will also kill metadata proxy process which was stared by python2,
but python2 was not allowed in rootwrap file.

Change-Id: Ia740113325c4c5f7fd9e0695b8af86bfc7208105
Closes-bug: #1617864

subject: Add check to prevent overwriting connected route from ex-routes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 00:46:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/85bc298c0dd4abe5b2bc3480b0dcf8f685a4b83d', 'message': 'Add check to prevent overwriting connected route from ex-routes

This patch adds following checks and if the request hits to condition below,
the request is returned with 409 error.
* update extra route
  Specified destination(CIDR) for extra routes is same as
  CIDR that is attached to router.
* add router interface
  CIDR of specified router interface to be attached to router is same as
  destination(CIDR) that is defined as extra routes.

Change-Id: I321c08fb899dedba3e05b8447b3b5f1fc89bd5d1
Closes-bug: #1339028
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 11:49:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7396e729f490f3ba5573304bf8e8e025bd6cf464', 'message': 'Add check to prevent overwriting connected route from ex-routes

This patch adds following checks and if the request hits to condition below,
the request is returned with 409 error.
* update extra route
  Specified destination(CIDR) for extra routes is same as
  CIDR that is attached to router.
* add router interface
  CIDR of specified router interface to be attached to router is same as

commit_message:
Add check to prevent overwriting connected route from ex-routes

This patch adds following checks and if the request hits to condition below,
the request is returned with 409 error.
* update extra route
  Specified destination(CIDR) for extra routes is same as
  CIDR that is attached to router.
* add router interface
  CIDR of specified router interface to be attached to router is same as
  destination(CIDR) that is defined as extra routes.

Change-Id: I321c08fb899dedba3e05b8447b3b5f1fc89bd5d1
Closes-bug: #1339028

commit_message:
Revert "bug/1614766 work around"

Since patch https://review.openstack.org/357528 was merged, we need to
revert commit dc856788f37c4b57fee97fde1b1b23f6bfdfcefe.

Also we need to set the ovs.ovsdb_connection to ODL manager because
neutron dhcp and l3 agent will use that to talk to OVS.

Change-Id: Ia2faeec393faf9c0f686937bf014c61f21616f97

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Heat detach issue.

There is a threading issue in Heat on a delete stack. All
detaches happen simultaneously. The fix locks the portion
of code to determine accurately, the number of volumes left
in the storage group, at any given time, to prevent
attempting to remove a volume that is the last in the
storage group.

Change-Id: I84164a9abac35d962408febbe8d3af759beb6a94
Closes-Bug: #1630535
(cherry picked from commit d9ccfaef8ebec88c35e94f55fec7a631ae46a214)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/14/426514/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @lockutils.synchronized(storageGroupName + 'remove', "emc-remove-sg", True) def do_remove_volume_from_sg(): volumeInstanceNames = self.get_devices_from_storage_group( conn, storageGroupInstanceName) numVolInStorageGroup = len(volumeInstanceNames) LOG.debug( "There are %(numVol)d volumes in the storage group " "%(maskingGroup)s.", {'numVol': numVolInStorageGroup, 'maskingGroup': storageGroupInstanceName}) if numVolInStorageGroup == 1: # Last volume in the storage group. self._last_vol_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, volumeInstance, volumeInstance['ElementName'], extraSpecs) else: # Not the last volume so remove it from storage group self._multiple_vols_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, volumeInstance, volumeInstance['ElementName'], numVolInStorageGroup, extraSpecs) return do_remove_volume_from_sg() # Remove the volume from the storage group and delete the SG. self._remove_last_vol_and_delete_sg( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, volumeInstance.path, volumeName, extraSpecs) status = True
deleted_lines: volumeInstanceNames = self.get_devices_from_storage_group( conn, storageGroupInstanceName) numVolInStorageGroup = len(volumeInstanceNames) LOG.debug( "There are %(numVol)d volumes in the storage group " "%(maskingGroup)s.", {'numVol': numVolInStorageGroup, 'maskingGroup': storageGroupInstanceName}) if numVolInStorageGroup == 1: # Last volume in the storage group. self._last_vol_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, volumeInstance, volumeInstance['ElementName'], extraSpecs) else: # Not the last volume so remove it from storage group self._multiple_vols_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, volumeInstance, volumeInstance['ElementName'], numVolInStorageGroup, extraSpecs) if mvInstanceName: maskingViewInstance = conn.GetInstance( mvInstanceName, LocalOnly=False) maskingViewName = maskingViewInstance['ElementName'] else: # Remove the volume from the storage group and delete the SG. self._remove_last_vol_and_delete_sg( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, volumeInstance.path, volumeName, extraSpecs) status = True

commit_message:
Use oslo.concurrency execute instead of neutron's

The neutron-fwaas code uses the execute method from neutron.agent.linux.utils.
Instead of that, use the one from oslo_concurrency.processutils.

Change-Id: I6b822e1a0689c380c9b6a0be3f6d6e2245da6d92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/92/404992/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_concurrency import processutils processutils.execute(cmd, run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=True, extra_ok_codes=[1])
deleted_lines: from neutron.agent.linux import utils as linux_utils linux_utils.execute(cmd, run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=True, extra_ok_codes=[1])

commit_message:
[WIP] Expose resource_versions from agent_db in the REST API

It would be useful to expose the version that an agent is reporting, via
the API extension, similar to the API that the Nova compute service
offers[1][2].

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/agents.py#L68
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py#L1177

Change-Id: Iab9b15961e8a2e0103d97ab01727df1c3c1c74e6

commit_message:
qos rule doesn't have tenant_id

QoS rule doesn't have tenant_id according to db model and ovo object.
On the other hand, neutron/extension/qos.py defines tenant_id in rule.
This seems accidentally introduced by
the changeset of 4ee9eebd7dd5ed7c87d481eda500b664ae564644 and
the change id of If9c7a7b9b8a5d2367d8f3225fbf07d8e3ec8865d

This patch removes tenant_id from qos rule api definition.

Change-Id: If5077a909e42cf592d0ef804b04e7a26344d7bea
Closes-Bug: #1616547

commit_message:
Delete related conntrack when delete vm

When deleting vm, the conntrack for this vm is still
exist. This patch deletes removed port's conntrack entries
only in port's hosting node. Another patch [1] removes
this port's conntrack entries in remote hosts.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352440/

Closes-Bug: #1580377
Change-Id: Ia8132a62050eaa5e01377f653337b5792f158e2f
(cherry picked from commit 2acdcedb594d06e7c9f4f14e017c918a4a65c6b2)

Add direction field to QoS bandwidth limit.

This patch enables the direction (ingress/egress) field
on the QoS bandwidth limit rule object and CRUD commands.

Partial-Bug: 1614121
Depends-On: Iab86c77366bb3290c17f58f6a5a2a206414e49b6

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated cluster API

The cluster API hasn't been used, and is not planned to be put
into use, so remove from the codebase.

Also, eliminate the base class as there is only one subclass and
no plans for other client subclasses, so there is no need for a
base client class anymore.

Move the load_client call to the API class.

Change everywhere that uses the load_client call to use the
API class instead.

Change the test plugin to basically be a blank copy of the API
class for now, but it might be better to use Mocks to deal
with the API funcitons in unit tests, rather than a blank class.

Change-Id: I992957fc8cf615d5ff86385b95017e39533d4c76

Additional Newton Puppet Openstack release

We've had a bunch of improvements and fixes for various OS related
updates. So we would like to release 9.5.0 to capture all of these
improvements.

commit_message:
supporting disabling reporting process

the report generation process may require significant resources
(especially for ceph). it is only required for logging so support
disabling it.

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: Idede7bdae690e293ca204c5e3788f7e5144e7680
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Fix broken doc links

This patch fixes broken doc links as follows:
- Removes the ref to generate the 'modindex' as this only
applies to source that provides module level documentation
with class refs. For example [1]. Today we don't have any such
module doc in this project; and thus this generates a dead link.
It can be added later (if needed) and the modindex ref can be
added back in.
- Fixes various internal links that are using '.rst'; this needs to be
'.html' in order to link to the generated doc html files.
- Fixes an incorrect link; missing a space and has an unneeded
leading underscore.

For more details please see the bug report associated with this
fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/
master/neutron/neutron_plugin_base_v2.py#L19

Change-Id: I12e227ae1a3682a7268b75c844825d3f7464941b
Closes-Bug: #1656403

commit_message:
[Devstack] Add stack user to libvirt group

Ironic is needed to have libvirtd perms to manage VMs. When nova is
enabled all needed perms are granted in nova devstack plugin.
This patch ensures that stack user is added to libvirt group when nova
is not enabled.

Change-Id: If65002d775c9ff001f5a8e27ed1f6af1f8b4cf40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/64/426664/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(vsaienko) Add stack to libvirt group when installing without nova. if ! is_service_enabled nova; then if [[ "$os_VENDOR" =~ (Debian) ]]; then LIBVIRT_GROUP=libvirt else LIBVIRT_GROUP=libvirtd fi if ! getent group $LIBVIRT_GROUP >/dev/null; then sudo groupadd $LIBVIRT_GROUP fi add_user_to_group $STACK_USER $LIBVIRT_GROUP fi

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-31 23:45:04.000000000', 'files': ['instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/c9b3ffbc35c859f74a1881dbb353af87ef54a536', 'message': "Fix novaclient initialization

projectid argument of novaclient(<7.0) entry-point had several meaning
based on different cases. It was not user-friednly behavior, so Nova team
fixed that issue in novaclient 7.0 . Now projectid means project/tenant id
in terms of Keystone, like it should be from start. It was not totally
backward compatible change in case of possitional arguments.

To support all novaclient's supported versions (in terms of g-r), the best

Change-Id: I4d3a5b938c26a200a553b86bc8d096f67c673415
"}]
commit_message:
Fix novaclient initialization

projectid argument of novaclient(<7.0) entry-point had several meaning
based on different cases. It was not user-friednly behavior, so Nova team
fixed that issue in novaclient 7.0 . Now projectid means project/tenant id
in terms of Keystone, like it should be from start. It was not totally
backward compatible change in case of possitional arguments.

To support all novaclient's supported versions (in terms of g-r), the best
way - use tenant_id keyword argument while initialization.

Change-Id: I4d3a5b938c26a200a553b86bc8d096f67c673415

added_lines: def _list_snapshots_param_sort(self, sort_key, sort_dir): """list snapshots by sort param""" params = {'sort_key': sort_key, 'sort_dir': sort_dir } snap_list = self.snapshots_client.list_snapshots(**params)['snapshots'] snap_id0 = snap_list[0]['id'] snap_id1 = snap_list[1]['id'] if sort_dir == 'asc': self.assertLess(snap_id0, snap_id1) elif sort_dir == 'desc': self.assertGreater(snap_id0, snap_id1) @test.idempotent_id('c5513ada-64c1-4d28-83b9-af3307ec1388') def test_snapshot_list_param_sort_asc_direction(self): self._list_snapshots_param_sort(sort_key='id', sort_dir='asc') @test.idempotent_id('8a7fe058-0b41-402a-8afd-2dbc5a4a718b') def test_snapshot_list_param_sort_desc_direction(self): self._list_snapshots_param_sort(sort_key='id', sort_dir='asc')

commit_message:
Move FDB population 'valid_type_drivers' variable to be a class constant

When initializing Fdb population agent extension we validate that
the extension is loaded on a permitted agent,
the list of permitted agents is assigned to the variable
valid_type_drivers located in the initialize method.
Moving valid_type_drivers to be class constant will be more
visible to anyone reading the code.

Change-Id: I97abfaceebee7f457c1c7da7dedfcd000e2fccea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/84/336884/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # valid agents for loading FDB population extension VALID_DRIVER_TYPES = (linux_bridge_constants.EXTENSION_DRIVER_TYPE, ovs_constants.EXTENSION_DRIVER_TYPE) if driver_type not in FdbPopulationAgentExtension.VALID_DRIVER_TYPES:
deleted_lines: valid_driver_types = (linux_bridge_constants.EXTENSION_DRIVER_TYPE, ovs_constants.EXTENSION_DRIVER_TYPE) if driver_type not in valid_driver_types: return False

commit_message:
Renamed [BGP] config section to [bgp]

Though oslo.config should not care about the case, it seems like
oslo-config-generator creates two separate sections with different case
if both are included.

commit_message:
Use addCleanup instead of tearDown

We should use addCleanup instead of tearDown because:
- tearDown is executed only if the test succeeds
- cleanups (defined with addCleanup) are executed even if the test fails

Change-Id: Ie341b54e119785b47be6e1ed44d82c2e8be4a1c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/73/427373/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def tearDown(self): self.restore_attribute_map() super(TestFirewallRouterPortBase, self).tearDown() def tearDown(self): super(TestFirewallPluginBasev2, self).tearDown()

commit_message:
Remove pxe_amt driver from pxe enable drivers list

This patch removes the deperacated pxe_amt driver from the list of
enabled pxe drivers. It also updates the README to indicate that
staging drivers must be manually added to enabled_drivers in ironic.conf.

Change-Id: I4fc63e1ac4e93dc7986e462598e46a02acd4a199
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/71/425871/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Note:: Including ``-e staging_drivers_include=true`` will install the staging drivers on the system but will not add them to ``enabled_drivers`` in the `ironic.conf` file. This must be done manually.

commit_message:
Adds getfattr and mount to Cinder rootwrap volume.filters

Adds getfattr and mount.quobyte which are run with root
ownership by the Quobyte driver if
nas_secure_file_operations is set to false.

Closes-Bug: #1586953

Change-Id: I135d96afb460e94f4396beb01894f731b562e614

commit_message:
Optimize _make_firewall_group_dict_with_rules

This change optimizes _make_firewall_group_dict_with_rules
implementation by getting rules for a firewall in one db query (through
the new method _get_policy_ordered_rules) instead of one db query per
rule (previous implementation) in order to improve performance.

Related-Bug: #1658817
Change-Id: Ibf13a9c0a4d504d47bd92fbd958c2d5e24abfdad

commit_message:
Do not wait Neutron by default with *_ssh driver

This patch removes deprecated behavior of waiting Neutron for 15
seconds for nodes with SSH power driver and when [neutron]/port_setup_delay
is not set.
With this change port_setup_delay should be set explicitly by user for
all power drivers.

Change-Id: Ib2e269200a6ddd614f5c7ef2726508f056546fbc

subject: Efficient passing of attrs during traversals
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 00:16:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/6c4626a40e154ede1cc9a1931c81d982a70b5bc0', 'message': "Skip stack outputs when building resource input_data

Don't bother iterating through stack outputs when
generating traversal input_data for resources.

Change-Id: I64089fb0774c10f172d986c3f87090e91cb3f263
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-13 07:22:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/482125679688112ddaf23825d1a94afb08086a38', 'message': "WIP - Efficient passing of attrs during traversals

Context: when a resource has been created or updated, it propagates
its attribute data along to resources that require it, and is also
stored in sync_point.input_data. Thus, the requirers themselves don't
need to re-resolve that attribute data.

Previously, all requirers would get *all* of the resource's attribute
data that any other resource or stack output depended on. With this
patch, only the attributes referred to by a given requirer are passed
along (so the attribute data passed to resource B may differ from the
attribute data passed to resource C). We save extra processing by only
looking at requirers, not all resources in the stack. Also, we no
longer iterate through stack outputs -- they are just not relevant to
dependent attributes between resources.

The prior behaviour would resolve a resource's attribute for each
requirer (repeating a potentially expensive operation). Now, we only
resolve an attribute once before passing it on as input_data to
potentially many requirers.

In short, there should be a performance boost here as well as some
space saved in sync_point.input_data.

Change-Id: I64089fb0774c10f172d986c3f87090e91cb3f263
Closes-Bug: #1656125
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-17 06:27:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/93b65cb51488e0544822a9855249d5793116f7a2', 'message': 'Skip stack outputs when building resource input_data

to send as input_data to the next resources in a traversal; it is at

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-17 18:25:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/5fcda59a17f339d3b0f641b4935530b4f30d3a29', 'message': 'Skip stack outputs when building resource input_data

Closes-Bug: #1656125
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-17 20:13:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/56af521d1b282b89eeb8bbef6cc51c7714feef9b', 'message': 'Efficient passing of attrs during traversals

commit_message:
Efficient passing of attrs during traversals

Two improvements:

Do not iterate through stack outputs when determining what attributes
to send as input_data to the next resources in a traversal; it is at
best extra processing and at worse results in extra attributes being
included in input_data.

Do not re-resolve attributes / re-calculate input_data when we already
have it. I.e., when a resource constructs input_data to send to a
requirer resource, that same input_data may be used for all other
requirer resources.

Change-Id: I64089fb0774c10f172d986c3f87090e91cb3f263
Closes-Bug: #1656125

commit_message:
Resource attrs for stack outputs stored in sync_point

Resource attributes referenced by a given stack's outputs are now
stored in that stack's sync_point (where entity_id == stack_id). When
a traversal is complete, this sync_point row is left untouched while
other resource-related rows are purged.

When loading stack outputs and the stack is in a COMPLETE state,
utilize the resource attributes already saved in the stack's
sync_point. I.e., populate stack.cache_data.

Change-Id: If6ac2c78455b29d80fdf4c6cddd941b210a546d8

commit_message:
Store stack outputs in the db

Store stack outputs in the db for COMPLETE stacks, thereby saving the
need to load child stacks when displaying a stack's output.

Change-Id: I6e7043a642525f3d2366abac823eb0b272874455

commit_message:
Only if loadbalancer's status is normal then create pool in db

When a loadbalancer is in PENDING_UPDATE state, creating a pool with
this lb will return http 409 error with "Invalid state PENDING_UPDATE
of loadbalancer resource LB_ID". But the pool already exists in the
database although the api return this error.

So we shall create a pool in db only if the loadbalancer's state is
normal, wich is consistent with creating listners.

Change-Id: Idb35d4e6ecdc46ff3748768774737b3b01d515f6
Closes-Bug: #1650170

commit_message:
Improve is_admin support in Patrole converter framework.

Right now is_admin rules are still causing issues. Fixes those
issues by checking for context_is_admin in the policy file under
test and whether the current role is_admin according to the rule
context_is_admin. This ensures that is_admin is reliably
passed to oslo policy's check.

Also adds support for services like nova, which does not
auto-generate a policy.json file. Uses oslo_policy.generator
in this case.

Change-Id: I91b567fd13130ebd9e3a9c49c46488c76d99d7a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/15/426415/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.alt_admin_policy_file = os.path.join(current_directory, 'resources', 'alt_admin_rbac_policy.json') 'admin_rule', 'is_admin_rule', 'alt_admin_rule' disallowed_rules = ['non_admin_rule'] def test_admin_policy_file_with_context_is_admin(self): converter = rbac_role_converter.RbacPolicyConverter( None, "test", self.alt_admin_policy_file) role = 'fake_admin' allowed_rules = ['non_admin_rule'] disallowed_rules = ['admin_rule'] for rule in allowed_rules: allowed = converter.allowed(rule, role) self.assertTrue(allowed) for rule in disallowed_rules: allowed = converter.allowed(rule, role) self.assertFalse(allowed) role = 'super_admin' allowed_rules = ['admin_rule'] disallowed_rules = ['non_admin_rule'] for rule in allowed_rules: allowed = converter.allowed(rule, role) self.assertTrue(allowed) for rule in disallowed_rules: allowed = converter.allowed(rule, role) self.assertFalse(allowed)

commit_message:
Add note in README about Python 3 changes

Add a node that explains that for Python 3 you'll need to add a
.decode() function in the gitsha command. Also, note that you
need to import subprocess in the conf.py file.

Change-Id: I1eb42738be74de96fae0940f3e97283351602e95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/43/426843/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: metadata for the project where the docs reside. You'll also need to add `import subprocess` to the top of your `conf.py` file::.. note:: If you're using Python 3 to build, you'll need to adjust the ``gitsha`` command to add a ``.decode('utf-8')`` :: gitsha = subprocess.Popen( git_cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0].decode('utf-8').strip('\n')
deleted_lines: metadata for the project where the docs reside::

commit_message:
validate-simple: small improvements

* silence the console output from curl but keep error output to avoid
  garbled download output in the logs
* acquire the floating IP address from the stack output to test the same
  way as tripleo-ci
* follow up the heat template differences (key -> key_pair)

Change-Id: I4c2bbbc3d542bf62f375d81f70069dff2490fc36

commit_message:
Ensure all containers have imagePullPolicy

This PS adds the imagePullPolicy to all containers
and provides a test to ensure it is always there.

Implements: blueprint image-pull-policy

Change-Id: I9a94e3a1ab909dcea0960b490aa57a5432780961

commit_message:
Add routed network scenario test cases

The scenario test cases for routed network. It includes
check instance's connectivity  with nova create port
and the instance connectivity with pre-allocated port.
It also includes check the clean up work when the port
allocation failed.

Change-Id: I985bafb44c131d6013961eb12bdbd103b6b6469a
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/88/347188/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import subprocess import time from neutron.tests.tempest.api import base as base_api from neutron.tests.tempest import config from neutron.tests.tempest.scenario import constants from tempest.common import waiters from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF class RoutedNetworkTest(base_api.BaseAdminNetworkTest): @classmethod def resource_setup(self): super(base_api.BaseAdminNetworkTest, self).resource_setup() self.servers = [] self.keypairs = [] @classmethod def resource_cleanup(self): for server in self.servers: self.manager.servers_client.delete_server(server) waiters.wait_for_server_termination(self.manager.servers_client, server) for keypair in self.keypairs: self.manager.keypairs_client.delete_keypair( keypair_name=keypair['name']) super(base_api.BaseAdminNetworkTest, self).resource_cleanup() def _create_keypair(self, client=None): name = data_utils.rand_name('keypair-test') client = client or self.manager.keypairs_client body = client.create_keypair(name=name) self.keypairs.append(body['keypair']) return body['keypair'] def _create_secgroup_rules(self, rule_list, secgroup_id=None): client = self.manager.network_client if not secgroup_id: sgs = client.list_security_groups()['security_groups'] for sg in sgs: if sg['name'] == constants.DEFAULT_SECURITY_GROUP: secgroup_id = sg['id'] break for rule in rule_list: direction = rule.pop('direction') client.create_security_group_rule( direction=direction, security_group_id=secgroup_id, **rule) def _create_loginable_secgroup_rule(self, secgroup_id=None): """This rule is intended to permit inbound ssh Allowing ssh traffic traffic from all sources, so no group_id is provided. Setting a group_id would only permit traffic from ports belonging to the same security group. """ rule_list = [{'protocol': 'tcp', 'direction': 'ingress', 'port_range_min': 22, 'port_range_max': 22, 'remote_ip_prefix': '0.0.0.0/0'}, {'protocol': 'icmp', 'direction': 'ingress', 'remote_ip_prefix': '0.0.0.0/0'} ] self._create_secgroup_rules(rule_list, secgroup_id=secgroup_id) def _create_server(self, flavor_ref, image_ref, key_name, networks, name=None): name = name or data_utils.rand_name('server-test') server = self.manager.servers_client.create_server( name=name, flavorRef=flavor_ref, imageRef=image_ref, key_name=key_name, networks=networks) self.servers.append(server['server']['id']) return server def _check_connectivity(self): for fixed_ip in self.port['fixed_ips']: ip = fixed_ip['ip_address'] self._ping_check(ip, self.namespace) def _ping_check(self, ip, namespace, retries=10): ret = 1 for i in range(0, retries): ret = subprocess.call( 'sudo ip net exec %s ping -c 1 %s' % (namespace, ip), shell=True, stdout=open('/dev/null', 'w'), stderr=subprocess.STDOUT) # self.assertEqual(0, ret) if ret == 0: break time.sleep(5) self.assertEqual(0, ret, 'instance is down') def _setup_network_and_server(self, phy_network="physnet1", network_type='vlan', pre_poort=False): segment_id = 2019 network_name = data_utils.rand_name("test-routed_network") segments = [{"provider:segmentation_id": segment_id, "provider:physical_network": phy_network, "provider:network_type": network_type}] kwargs = {'shared': True, 'segments': segments, "router:external": "False"} self.network = self.create_shared_network( network_name=network_name, **kwargs) kwargs_net = {'network_id': self.network['id'], 'physical_network': phy_network } ret_segment = self.list_segments(**kwargs_net) kwargs_subnet = { 'name': data_utils.rand_name("test-routed_subnet"), 'segment_id': ret_segment['segments'][0]['id'] } self.subnet = self.create_subnet( self.network, client=self.admin_client, ip_version=4, **kwargs_subnet) self.keypair = self._create_keypair() self._create_loginable_secgroup_rule() # test_net_id = self.client.list_networks()['networks'][1]['id'] if pre_poort is True: self.port = self.create_port(self.network) self.server = self._create_server( flavor_ref=CONF.compute.flavor_ref, image_ref=CONF.compute.image_ref, key_name=self.keypair['name'], networks=[{'port': self.port['id']}]) else: self.server = self._create_server( flavor_ref=CONF.compute.flavor_ref, image_ref=CONF.compute.image_ref, key_name=self.keypair['name'], networks=[{'uuid': self.network['id']}]) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.manager.servers_client, self.server['server']['id'], constants.SERVER_STATUS_ACTIVE) self.namespace = 'qdhcp-' + self.network['id'] self.port = self.client.list_ports(network_id=self.network['id'], device_id=self.server[ 'server']['id'])['ports'][0] @test.idempotent_id('953d4048-0388-4fb5-beca-f85e07ba8b1e') def test_routed_network(self): self._setup_network_and_server(pre_poort=False) self._check_connectivity()

commit_message:
Fix test failure caused by change to puppet-octavia

Fixes a test failure caused by Ic38d4f9f9a8e69ffcee6ccc4bba9a9ab0f161d0e
which pulls in a class with a required parameter.

Change-Id: I0740290bff0ea7c4af6e3420775ac3e72871d372
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/74/427374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
